segment.source: Manage Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection alerts
segment.target: Manage Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection alerts

segment.source: Change the status of alerts, create suppression rules to hide alerts, submit comments, and review change history for individual alerts with the Manage Alert menu.
segment.target: Change the status of alerts, create suppression rules to hide alerts, submit comments, and review change history for individual alerts with the Manage Alert menu.

segment.source: Manage Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection alerts
segment.target: Manage Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection alerts

segment.source: Applies to:
segment.target: Applies to:

segment.source: Windows 10 Insider Preview Build 14332 or later
segment.target: Windows 10 Insider Preview Build 14332 or later

segment.source: Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection (Windows Defender ATP)
segment.target: Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection (Windows Defender ATP)

segment.source: [Some information relates to pre-released product which may be substantially modified before it's commercially released.
segment.target: [Some information relates to pre-released product which may be substantially modified before it's commercially released.

segment.source: Microsoft makes no warranties, express or implied, with respect to the information provided here.]
segment.target: Microsoft makes no warranties, express or implied, with respect to the information provided here.]

segment.source: Windows Defender ATP notifies you of detected, possible attacks or breaches through alerts.
segment.target: Windows Defender ATP notifies you of detected, possible attacks or breaches through alerts.

segment.source: A summary of new alerts is displayed in the Dashboard, and you can access all alerts in the Alerts queue menu.
segment.target: A summary of new alerts is displayed in the Dashboard, and you can access all alerts in the Alerts queue menu.

segment.source: See the Investigate Windows Defender ATP alerts topic for more details on how to investigate alerts.
segment.target: See the Investigate Windows Defender ATP alerts topic for more details on how to investigate alerts.

segment.source: Click the Manage Alert menu icon The menu icon looks like three periods stacked on top of each other on the top of the alert to access the Manage Alert menu and manage alerts.
segment.target: Click the Manage Alert menu icon The menu icon looks like three periods stacked on top of each other on the top of the alert to access the Manage Alert menu and manage alerts.

segment.source: The manage alert menu lets you change the status of an alert, create suppression rules, or enter comments
segment.target: The manage alert menu lets you change the status of an alert, create suppression rules, or enter comments

segment.source: The Manage alert icon appears on the alert's heading in the New, In Progress, or Resolved queues, and on the details page for individual alerts.
segment.target: The Manage alert icon appears on the alert's heading in the New, In Progress, or Resolved queues, and on the details page for individual alerts.

segment.source: You can use the Manage Alert menu to:
segment.target: You can use the Manage Alert menu to:

segment.source: Change the status of an alert
segment.target: Change the status of an alert

segment.source: Resolve an alert
segment.target: Resolve an alert

segment.source: Suppress alerts so they won't show up in the Alerts queue from this point onwards
segment.target: Suppress alerts so they won't show up in the Alerts queue from this point onwards

segment.source: View the history and comments of an alert
segment.target: View the history and comments of an alert

segment.source: Change the status of an alert
segment.target: Change the status of an alert

segment.source: You can categorize alerts (as New, In Progress, or Resolved) by changing their status as your investigation progresses.
segment.target: You can categorize alerts (as New, In Progress, or Resolved) by changing their status as your investigation progresses.

segment.source: This helps you organize and manage how your team can respond to alerts.
segment.target: This helps you organize and manage how your team can respond to alerts.

segment.source: For example, a team leader can review all New alerts, and decide to assign them to the In Progress queue for further analysis.
segment.target: For example, a team leader can review all New alerts, and decide to assign them to the In Progress queue for further analysis.

segment.source: Alternatively, the team leader might assign the alert to the Resolved queue if they know the alert is benign, coming from a machine that is irrelevant (such as one belonging to a security administrator), or is being dealt with through an earlier alert.
segment.target: Alternatively, the team leader might assign the alert to the Resolved queue if they know the alert is benign, coming from a machine that is irrelevant (such as one belonging to a security administrator), or is being dealt with through an earlier alert.

segment.source: Change an alert's status:
segment.target: Change an alert's status:

segment.source: Click the Manage Alert menu icon The menu icon looks like three periods stacked on top of each other on the heading of the alert.
segment.target: Click the Manage Alert menu icon The menu icon looks like three periods stacked on top of each other on the heading of the alert.

segment.source: Choose the new status for the alert (the current status is highlighted in bold and appears on the alert).
segment.target: Choose the new status for the alert (the current status is highlighted in bold and appears on the alert).

segment.source: Resolve an alert
segment.target: Resolve an alert

segment.source: You can resolve an alert by changing the status of the alert to Resolved.
segment.target: You can resolve an alert by changing the status of the alert to Resolved.

segment.source: This causes the Resolve conclusion window to appear, where you can indicate why the alert was resolved and enter any additional comments.
segment.target: This causes the Resolve conclusion window to appear, where you can indicate why the alert was resolved and enter any additional comments.

segment.source: You can resolve an alert as valid, valid - allowed, or false alarm
segment.target: You can resolve an alert as valid, valid - allowed, or false alarm

segment.source: The comments and change of status are recorded in the Comments and history window.
segment.target: The comments and change of status are recorded in the Comments and history window.

segment.source: The comments window will display a history of status changes
segment.target: The comments window will display a history of status changes

segment.source: Suppress alerts
segment.target: Suppress alerts

segment.source: Windows Defender ATP lets you create suppression rules so you can limit the alerts you see in the Alerts queue.
segment.target: Windows Defender ATP lets you create suppression rules so you can limit the alerts you see in the Alerts queue.

segment.source: Suppression rules can be created from an existing alert.
segment.target: Suppression rules can be created from an existing alert.

segment.source: When a suppression rule is created, it will take effect from this point onwards.
segment.target: When a suppression rule is created, it will take effect from this point onwards.

segment.source: It will not affect existing alerts already in the queue, but new alerts triggered after the rule is created will not be displayed.
segment.target: It will not affect existing alerts already in the queue, but new alerts triggered after the rule is created will not be displayed.

segment.source: There are two contexts for a suppression rule that you can choose from:
segment.target: There are two contexts for a suppression rule that you can choose from:

segment.source: Suppress alert on this machine
segment.target: Suppress alert on this machine

segment.source: Suppress alert in my organization
segment.target: Suppress alert in my organization

segment.source: The context of the rule lets you tailor the queue to ensure that only alerts you are interested in will appear.
segment.target: The context of the rule lets you tailor the queue to ensure that only alerts you are interested in will appear.

segment.source: You can use the examples in the following table to help you choose the context for a suppression rule:
segment.target: You can use the examples in the following table to help you choose the context for a suppression rule:

segment.source: Context
segment.target: Context

segment.source: Definition
segment.target: Definition

segment.source: Example scenarios
segment.target: Example scenarios

segment.source: Suppress alert on this machine
segment.target: Suppress alert on this machine

segment.source: Alerts with the same alert title and on that specific machine only will be suppressed.
segment.target: Alerts with the same alert title and on that specific machine only will be suppressed.

segment.source: All other alerts on that machine will not be suppressed.
segment.target: All other alerts on that machine will not be suppressed.

segment.source: A security researcher is investigating a malicious script that has been used to attack other machines in your organization.
segment.target: A security researcher is investigating a malicious script that has been used to attack other machines in your organization.

segment.source: A developer regularly creates PowerShell scripts for their team.
segment.target: A developer regularly creates PowerShell scripts for their team.

segment.source: Suppress alert in my organization
segment.target: Suppress alert in my organization

segment.source: Alerts with the same alert title on any machine will be suppressed.
segment.target: Alerts with the same alert title on any machine will be suppressed.

segment.source: A benign administrative tool is used by everyone in your organization.
segment.target: A benign administrative tool is used by everyone in your organization.

segment.source: Suppress an alert and create a suppression rule:
segment.target: Suppress an alert and create a suppression rule:

segment.source: Click the Manage Alert menu icon The menu icon looks like three periods stacked on top of each other on the heading of an existing alert.
segment.target: Click the Manage Alert menu icon The menu icon looks like three periods stacked on top of each other on the heading of an existing alert.

segment.source: Choose the context for suppressing the alert.
segment.target: Choose the context for suppressing the alert.

segment.source: Note You cannot create a custom or blank suppression rule.
segment.target: Note You cannot create a custom or blank suppression rule.

segment.source: You must start from an existing alert.
segment.target: You must start from an existing alert.

segment.source: See the list of suppression rules:
segment.target: See the list of suppression rules:

segment.source: Click the settings icon
segment.target: Click the settings icon

segment.source: The settings icon looks like a cogwheel or gear
segment.target: The settings icon looks like a cogwheel or gear

segment.source: on the main menu bar at the top of the Windows Defender ATP screen.
segment.target: on the main menu bar at the top of the Windows Defender ATP screen.

segment.source: Click Suppression rules.
segment.target: Click Suppression rules.

segment.source: Click the settings icon and then Suppression rules to create and modify rules
segment.target: Click the settings icon and then Suppression rules to create and modify rules

segment.source: Note You can also click See rules in the confirmation window that appears when you suppress an alert.
segment.target: Note You can also click See rules in the confirmation window that appears when you suppress an alert.

segment.source: The list of suppression rules shows all the rules that users in your organization have created.
segment.target: The list of suppression rules shows all the rules that users in your organization have created.

segment.source: Each rule shows:
segment.target: Each rule shows:

segment.source: (1) The title of the alert that is suppressed
segment.target: (1) The title of the alert that is suppressed

segment.source: (2) Whether the alert was suppressed for a single machine (clicking the machine name will allow you to investigate the machine) or the entire organization
segment.target: (2) Whether the alert was suppressed for a single machine (clicking the machine name will allow you to investigate the machine) or the entire organization

segment.source: (3) The date when the alert was suppressed
segment.target: (3) The date when the alert was suppressed

segment.source: (4) An option to delete the suppression rule, which will cause alerts with this title to be displayed in the queue from this point onwards.
segment.target: (4) An option to delete the suppression rule, which will cause alerts with this title to be displayed in the queue from this point onwards.

segment.source: Suppression rules show the rule name or title, the context, the date, and an icon to delete the rule
segment.target: Suppression rules show the rule name or title, the context, the date, and an icon to delete the rule

segment.source: View the history and comments of an alert
segment.target: View the history and comments of an alert

segment.source: You can use the Manage Alert menu icon The menu icon looks like three periods stacked on top of each other to see a list of previous changes and comments made to the alert and to add new comments.
segment.target: You can use the Manage Alert menu icon The menu icon looks like three periods stacked on top of each other to see a list of previous changes and comments made to the alert and to add new comments.

segment.source: You can also use the menu to open multiple alerts in different tabs so you can compare several alerts at the same time.
segment.target: You can also use the menu to open multiple alerts in different tabs so you can compare several alerts at the same time.

segment.source: Whenever a change or comment is made to an alert, it is recorded in the Comments and history window.
segment.target: Whenever a change or comment is made to an alert, it is recorded in the Comments and history window.

segment.source: See the history of an alert and its comments:
segment.target: See the history of an alert and its comments:

segment.source: Click the Manage Alert menu icon The menu icon looks like three periods stacked on top of each other on the heading of the alert.
segment.target: Click the Manage Alert menu icon The menu icon looks like three periods stacked on top of each other on the heading of the alert.

segment.source: Click Comments and history to view related comments and history on the alert.
segment.target: Click Comments and history to view related comments and history on the alert.

segment.source: Comments are indicated by a message box icon (
segment.target: Comments are indicated by a message box icon (

segment.source: The comments icon looks like a speech bubble
segment.target: The comments icon looks like a speech bubble

segment.source: ) and include the username of the commenter and the time the comment was made.
segment.target: ) and include the username of the commenter and the time the comment was made.

segment.source: Add a new comment:
segment.target: Add a new comment:

segment.source: Type your comment into the field.
segment.target: Type your comment into the field.

segment.source: Click Post Comment.
segment.target: Click Post Comment.

segment.source: The comment will appear instantly.
segment.target: The comment will appear instantly.

segment.source: You will also be prompted to enter a comment if you change the status of an alert to Resolved.
segment.target: You will also be prompted to enter a comment if you change the status of an alert to Resolved.

segment.source: Changes are indicated by a clock icon (
segment.target: Changes are indicated by a clock icon (

segment.source: The changes icon looks like an analog clock face
segment.target: The changes icon looks like an analog clock face

segment.source: ), and are automatically recorded when:
segment.target: ), and are automatically recorded when:

segment.source: The alert is created
segment.target: The alert is created

segment.source: The status of the alert is changed
segment.target: The status of the alert is changed
